medical_history.chief_complaint: Multiple cranial nerve deficits progressing since early childhood.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in early childhood, including bilateral mixed conductive and sensorineural hearing loss, which led to total deafness in the left ear and residual hearing in the right. Intermittent headaches, peripheral facial palsy, and recurrent trigeminal neuralgia were also noted. Symptoms included swallowing difficulties and mild speech impairment reported during adolescence and adulthood.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Symmetric hyperostosis of tubular bones (ulna, radius, metacarpal bones, clavicles, ribs). Previous surgeries for decompression attempted but unsuccessful.
medical_history.family_history: Patient has two older sisters; one sister exhibited similar but milder symptoms. Parents were neither affected nor consanguineous.
